availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Special Studies and Reports to the Governor, 1862-1863

body.p: A list of maps, belonging to the State of Kentucky Loaned to the Office of the Engineeer of the 23 Army Corps Commanded by Majr Gen Geo D Hartsuff --

1 Map of Ky River.
2 Louisville & Bardstown Turnpike
3 Goose Cr. and South fork Ky.
4 Little Sandy.
5. Smiths Shoals Cumberland river
6 Jamestown to Monticello --.
7 Georget'n pike.
8 Poplar Plains.
9 Pike Hardansville to Mercer line
10 Bardstown and Green River pike
11 Greensburgh to Prestonville
12 Lancaster & Nicholasville pike
13 Cumberland River to Big Burn
14. Covington to Georget'n
15 Harrodsburgh to Chaplin River
16 Smith fork of Cumberland.
17 Little River
18 Lexington to Winchester
19 Perryville & Danville
20 Versails and Anderson Road,
21 Jamestown ' Grensburgh
21 Bells to Bowling green
Washing22 Washington to mouth of Sandy.
23 Green River to line.
24 Sketch --
25 North fork of Ky river sketch
26 Sketchs upper part of Cumberland river.
27 Map of North Carolina
28 " " Mississippi -
29 " " Alabama. --
30 " " Indiana. --

Sidney S. Lyon
Capt. Acting Art Engr.
On Topographical Duty.
These maps will be returned in as good order as they now are. So soon as they are copied

Maps belonging to State Ky delivered to Maj. Genl. Hartsuff
Aug 7. 1863
